Here Jesus refers to himself in the third person. AT: "I, the Son of man ... my Father ... Then I" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])
contextId.quote: the Son of Man ... his Father ... Then he

contextId.information: "and the angels will be with him." If you translate the first part of the sentence with Jesus speaking in the first person, you can translate this as "and my Father's angels will be with me." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])
Jesus is speaking about himself. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])
Jesus is referring to himself in the third person. If necessary, you can translate these in the first person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])
Jesus is speaking about himself in the third person. If necessary, you can translate this in the first person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])
contextId.quote: the Son of Man ... his life

contextId.information: When Jesus said "the Christ," he was speaking about himself in the third person. AT: "I, the Christ, am your only teacher" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])
contextId.quote: you have only one teacher, the Christ

contextId.information: Jesus is speaking about himself in the third person. AT: "the time for me to come is near" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])

Here, "the King" is another title for the Son of Man. Jesus was referring to himself in the third person. AT: "I, the King, ... my right hand" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])
"Then the King will." Jesus is speaking about himself in the third person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])
